climbs.name: Ramp
climbs.fa: recorded ascent Bradley White and Paul, 1983

content.description: Climb 5.0-3 ramp to short head wall and go pass some horizontal splits to summit
content.protection: Run out for 80 feet and then some pro to finish the head wall.

content.description: Ascend the V groove split and move left onto face to finish. Steep and great feet and hands keep it moderately done
content.protection: Free soloed. Likely stoppers and medium/small cams
content.location: A few feet right of North One

content.description: Climb face around the inclining wall when the angle decreases. Crux is getting over a couple of horizontally split overlap like features. Very knobby rock.
content.protection: Free soloed and stoppers and medium/small cams would work.

content.description: Midway up right side of ramp traverse on inclining diagonal horizontal off width and fist cam crack for  10-15 feet of crux. Really secured holds. Enter leg and arm off width to summit on really secured holds. Again largest cams besides the beginning from exiting the ramp on to the diagonal crack. Very dangerous pendulum fall potential onto the ramp. Free soloed
content.protection: Giant cams and and repeated ascent with Paul.
content.location: Diagonal crack right besides the off width midway up the ramp.

climbs.name: The Deceiving Off Width
climbs.fa: recorded ascent Bradley White and Paul, 1983

content.description: Midway up right side of ramp is this inclining off width. Much harder than it looks. Deception is it looks vertical and its first fifteen feet of crux are inclining and require pretzel logic to ascend. Then angle becomes vertical and grade of climbing more reasonable.
content.protection: Giant cams but having none I had one piece in below it that would not help much because the low angle ramp would be hit with much force if I had fallen.
content.location: Vertical off width right midway up right side of the ramp.

climbs.name: Crumble Stone Off Width
climbs.fa: recorded ascent Bradley White and Paul, 1983

content.description: Acid rain eroded chimney off width. Not bad but does have crumble stone surface and its a scratch you up off width because of the rocks texture. Almost body width and slightly inclined. We lay back parts of it making it a very committing lead and for the most part its a standard worm your way up off width to wide for cams and tube protection would fit but placing it would be difficult.
content.protection: Left of ramp is the longest vertical crack
content.location: Left of center low angle ramp.

content.description: Don't know about earlier ascents. I climbed it in 1983 by several ways and with or without a rope all the crack routes are X without giant cams or tubes. North side is short and similar rock to Pinnacle Buttress, Huntington Ravine, Mt Washington and has the best protection. North side lines utilize smaller protection and center and south side are wide granite cracks that would require the largest cams or tubes.    Too long a hike to bring up these heavy cams in my opinion. The center is a low angle ramp to a short head wall and left of it is the widest chimney like off width crack, right of center ramp are two off width cracks and furthest right access is diagonal horizontal crack to narrowest off width with finish. Belay is easily set up at summit for top roping everything and not much to anchor a belay at ledges base. Center is about 100 feet maybe more? South side is 30-40 feet. Much more potential for routes on south side.     Helmet is a good idea here because people on summit may drop something or purposely throw something off. They will have no idea climbers are beneath them.
